intro: Reseda hexagyna, commonly known as the six-angled reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and narrow, linear leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open fields and along roadsides. Reseda hexagyna is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
